items.title: David Beckham breaks silence after son Brooklyn cuts ties
items.description: The football superstar told broadcasters at the World Economic Forum that "children are allowed to make mistakes" in his first public comments since his son's allegations went public.

items.title: Baby killer Lucy Letby to face no further criminal charges
items.description: The UK's Crown Prosecution Service says it considered the offences of murder or attempted murder in relation to the deaths of nine babies.

items.title: Israel demolishes UNRWA headquarters in East Jerusalem

featured_image.name: Israel demolishes buildings in UN Palestinian agency's East Jerusalem compound

items.description:
Israeli bulldozers tore down buildings at the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) headquarters in occupied East Jerusalem on Tuesday morning, in what the UN agency condemned as an "unprecedented attack" and a serious violation of international law.

Shortly after 7 a.m. local time, Israeli forces entered the compound in the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood, expelled security personnel, confiscated staff equipment, and began demolishing structures with heavy machinery, according to UNRWA spokesperson Jonathan Fowler. An Israeli flag was raised over the premises, replacing the UN flag.[1][2][3][4]

Far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir arrived at the scene to observe the demolition. "This is a historic day, a day of celebration, and a very important day for governance in Jerusalem," Ben-Gvir said in a statement. "For years, these supporters of terrorism were here, and today they are being removed from here along with everything they built."[2][5]

items.title: 'He's a T-Rex': Newsom tells US allies 'stand united' against Trump amid Greenland crisis
items.description: As European leaders struggle to come up with ways to ease the US president's ambition for a take over of Greenland, a prominent Democrat is accusing them of "rolling over".

items.title: Greenland PM tells residents to prepare for possible invasion

featured_image.name: Greenland not seeking to join EU or be part of US, PM Nielsen says

items.description:
Greenland's Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen on Tuesday told residents to prepare for a possible military invasion, delivering a stark warning as tensions between the United States and European allies over the Arctic territory escalate to unprecedented levels.

"It's not likely there will be a military conflict, but it can't be ruled out," Nielsen said at a press conference in the capital Nuuk. "The leader on the other side, US President Donald Trump, has said very clearly that it is not out of the question, and we should of course be prepared for all possible scenarios."[1][2]

The warning comes as Greenlanders grapple with the reality of life at the center of an international crisis, with residents stockpiling supplies and planning escape routes while refusing to bow to American pressure.

items.title: Trump’s Board of Peace meets resistance from key allies

featured_image.name: Trump threatens 200% tariff on French wines and champagnes

items.description:
President Donald Trump's newly established Board of Peace is encountering resistance from key allies as world leaders grapple with a controversial charter requiring $1 billion for permanent membership and granting Trump near-total control over the international body.

The initiative, originally conceived to oversee Gaza's reconstruction following the October 2025 ceasefire, has evolved into a far more ambitious enterprise. According to the charter, which has been reviewed by multiple news outlets, the board aims to "promote stability, restore dependable and lawful governance, and secure enduring peace in areas affected or threatened by conflict"—language that makes no mention of Gaza.[1][2][3]

items.title: Trump, NATO chief agree to Davos meeting on Greenland

featured_image.name: Trump Says He Spoke to NATO Chief Rutte on Greenland

items.description:
President Donald Trump announced on Monday that he had a "very good" telephone call with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte about Greenland and agreed to convene "various parties" at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, escalating a diplomatic crisis that has strained transatlantic relations.

"As I expressed to everyone, very plainly, Greenland is imperative for National and World Security. There can be no going back — On that, everyone agrees!" Trump wrote on Truth Social.[1][2][3]

items.title: Ukraine's Chornobyl plant reconnected to grid after Russian strikes

featured_image.name: Chornobyl Nuclear Plant temporarily loses power after ...

items.description:
Ukraine's Chornobyl Nuclear Power Plant has been reconnected to the country's power grid following a massive overnight Russian drone and missile assault that temporarily knocked out all external power to the facility, with officials confirming radiation levels remain normal.

The International Atomic Energy Agency confirmed early Tuesday that the plant, site of the world's worst civil nuclear disaster, had lost all off-site power after Russian forces targeted energy infrastructure across Ukraine. "Several Ukrainian electrical substations vital for nuclear safety were affected by widespread military activity this morning," IAEA Director General Rafael Grossi said on X.[1][2][3]

Ukraine's energy ministry announced later Tuesday that power had been restored and radiation levels posed no threat.[4][5][6]

items.title: Trump intensifies pressure on European allies over Greenland demands

featured_image.name: Europe hits back at Trump tariff threat over Greenland

items.description: President Donald Trump intensified his campaign to acquire Greenland on Tuesday, posting AI-generated images of himself planting an American flag on the Arctic territory while threatening European allies with tariffs unless they relent on what he called an "imperative" matter of national security. The escalating pressure comes as European leaders prepare for tense meetings at the World Economic Forum in Davos, with EU officials vowing an "unflinching" response to what they describe as coercion against a longtime ally.

items.title: Japan's 40-year bond suffers historic selloff amid fears over tax cut plan
items.description:
Japanese government bonds experienced a historic meltdown on Tuesday as fiscal concerns over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's unfunded tax cut promises sent long-dated yields surging to levels not seen in decades, triggering a selloff that spread across global financial markets.

The yield on Japan's 40-year government bond rocketed past 4%, the highest since this maturity was introduced in 2007 and a first for any sovereign debt instrument in the country in more than three decades. The 30-year yield climbed to a record 3.875%, while the benchmark 10-year yield rose above 2.3%, its highest level since 1999.[1][2][3]

items.title: Massive Chinese embassy in London approved despite 'nest of spies' concerns
items.description: The new embassy will sit in the city's Royal Mint Court alongside London's famous financial hub, despite experts and human rights groups raising concerns about foreign interference.

items.title: Hubble images show interstellar object's jets in rare symmetry

featured_image.name: Three perfect mini-jets, one chilling question: Is 3I/ATLAS engineered?

items.description:
New images of the interstellar visitor 3I/ATLAS from the Hubble Space Telescope have revealed an unusual configuration of jets emanating from its nucleus, with three distinct plumes arranged in near-perfect 120-degree symmetry. Harvard astrophysicist Avi Loeb, who has been analyzing the data, says the geometric precision of the formation is difficult to reconcile with standard cometary outgassing and raises questions about the object's origins.

Images captured by Hubble on January 7 and January 14, 2026, and processed by researcher Toni Scarmato using the Larson-Sekanina Rotational Gradient filter, show three collimated mini-jets extending tens of thousands of kilometers into space, each separated by exactly 120 degrees in projection. A fourth "anti-tail" jet points directly toward the sun, stretching up to 400,000 kilometers — a length that Loeb argues has never been reported before for solar system comets.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: NSW's first female governor Dame Marie Bashir dies aged 95
items.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns says a state funeral will be held for the veteran public servant, who he describes as "an extraordinary Australian".

items.title: Chinese researchers achieve 31% efficiency in perovskite solar cells

featured_image.name: Chinese scientists boost perovskite solar cell efficiency ...

items.description:
Scientists in China and Hong Kong have announced separate advances in perovskite solar cell technology this month, addressing long-standing challenges with both efficiency and stability that have hindered the material's commercial adoption.

A research team from Northwestern Polytechnical University, in collaboration with Xi'an Shiyou University and Xidian University, developed a novel crystallization strategy using a two-dimensional seeding agent to achieve 31.13% efficiency in a perovskite-silicon tandem solar cell. Separately, engineers at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology created a "Molecular Velcro" coating that enables cells to retain over 95% of their initial efficiency after more than 1,100 hours of continuous operation under intense heat.[1][2][3][4][5]

items.title: Asian and European stocks fall as Trump tariff threats roil markets

featured_image.name: European stocks slide as Trump's Greenland tariff threat rattles investors

items.description:
Stock markets across Asia and Europe tumbled Tuesday as investors grappled with escalating trade tensions after President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on eight European nations in his bid to acquire Greenland, while Japan's snap election announcement failed to lift regional sentiment.

The pan-European STOXX 600 fell 0.8% on Tuesday, extending its worst session in over two months, while the STOXX 50 declined 0.4%. In Asia, Japan's Nikkei 225 dropped approximately 0.8%, while Hong Kong's Hang Seng and China's Shanghai Composite shed 0.1% to 0.5%.[1][2][3][4][5]

items.title: Israel starts demolishing former UN aid agency headquarters
items.description: The UN has labelled Israel's move to bulldoze a former UNRWA headquarters a  "serious violation of international law".

items.title: Woolies' new AI system fundamentally changes the role of the shopper
items.description: Without scrutiny, agent-led shopping risks quietly reconfiguring consumer behaviour in ways that are difficult to detect — and even harder to reverse.

items.title: Labor's hate laws pass despite a divided Coalition
items.description: The federal government has passed new laws targeting hate groups with support from the Liberals, despite a last-ditch effort from the Nationals to make further amendments.

items.title: British-born Aussies giving up UK citizenship over new passport rules
items.description: Frustrated dual British-Australian citizens are weighing up their options in response to new passport rules. Here's why some are letting go of their British citizenship.

items.title: Osaka brings fashion to the court as plucky Aussies progress to second round
items.description: Seeing Naomi Osaka don a jellyfish-inspired outfit was one highlight of day three of the tournament, however two plucky Australians — Dane Sweeny and James Duckworth also put on a show.

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
